  1. try:
  2. from cStringIO import StringIO
  3. except ImportError:
  4. from StringIO import StringIO
  6. try:
  7. from PIL import Image
  8. except ImportError:
  9. import Image
  11. from easy_thumbnails import utils
  14. def pil_image(source, exif_orientation=True, **options):
  15. """
  16. Try to open the source file directly using PIL, ignoring any errors.
  18. exif_orientation
  20. If EXIF orientation data is present, perform any required reorientation
  21. before passing the data along the processing pipeline.
  23. """
  24. # Use a StringIO wrapper because if the source is an incomplete file like
  25. # object, PIL may have problems with it. For example, some image types
  26. # require tell and seek methods that are not present on all storage
  27. # File objects.
  28. if not source:
  29. return
  30. source = StringIO(source.read())
  31. try:
  32. image = Image.open(source)
  33. # Fully load the image now to catch any problems with the image
  34. # contents.
  35. image.load()
  36. except Exception:
  37. return
  39. if exif_orientation:
  40. image = utils.exif_orientation(image)
  41. return image
